intro: Nassauvia bryoides, commonly known as the mossy nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a fine, moss-like coating, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals arranged in a showy cluster. Nassauvia bryoides thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
